abstract: Medicare and Medicaid have transformed in their 50 years of existence from being publicly run programs to ones in which private companies have large and growing role; private health plans account for over half of Medicaid beneficiaries and more than 30 percent of Medicare beneficiaries, something that architects of programs would not have predicted.
lead_paragraph: Enrollment in private insurance plans has soared as the government has tried to control costs and improve care for Medicare and Medicaid beneficiaries.

headline.main: As Medicare and Medicaid Turn 50, Use of Private Health Plans Surges
headline.print_headline: As Medicare and Medicaid Turn 50, Use of Private Health Plans Surges

snippet: Enrollment in private insurance plans has soared as the government has tried to control costs and improve care for Medicare and Medicaid beneficiaries.
